title: Australia Told to Call out CCP Corruption in Pacific
description: Solomon Islands' Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare (R) and China's Premier Li Qiang inspect the guard of honour during a welcome ceremony at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China on July 10, 2023. (Andy Wong/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Death Warning as Potent Opioid Spreads to Four Australian States
description: Ambulances arrive at St Vincent's Hospital in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 28, 2021. (Jenny Evans/Getty Images)

title: Hundreds Rally in Toronto to Call on Beijing to End Decades-Long Persecution of Falun Gong
description: Hundreds of Falun Gong practitioners took part in a rally and a parade through downtown Toronto on July 15, 2023, to call on the Chinese regime to stop its persecution of Falun Gong. (Evan Ning/The Epoch Times)

title: Activist Charged After Storming Restaurant Banning Vegans
description: (L to R) Activists from the animal rights group PETA Asia wearing cutouts of Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, France's President Emmanuel Macron, U.S. President Joe Biden, and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz take part in a protest to urge governments to implement policies for transitioning to vegan food systems ahead of the G7 Leaders' Summit in Hiroshima on May 17, 2023. (Philip Fong/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Alberta, Saskatchewan Premiers Accuse Ottawa of Wanting to Shut Down Energy Sector
description: Environment Minister Steven Guilbeault, accompanied by Health Minister Jean-Yves Duclos, announces a ban on single-use plastics and items at a beach in Quebec City on June 20, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Jacques Boissinot)

title: Arrest Made After Mother of Two Killed on Toronto Street by Stray Bullet
description: Passers-by stop at a makeshift memorial at the place where a mother of two, Karolina Huebner-Makurat, was killed by a stray bullet, in Toronto on July 10, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Chris Young)

title: Green Party Leader Elizabeth May Suffered Stroke, Not Fatigue as First Thought
description: Green Party leader Elizabeth May speaks during a news conference in Ottawa on July 8, 2020. (The Canadian Press/Adrian Wyld)

title: Ben Wallace to Leave Government in Next Cabinet Reshuffle
description: Britain’s Secretary of State for Defence Ben Wallace attends the weekly Cabinet meeting at Downing Street, in London, on May 2, 2023. (Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)

title: Ontario CUPE Windsor-Essex Paramedics Union Begins Arbitration Fight Against Vaccine Mandates
description: A health worker uses a needle and a vial of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to prepare a dose at a vaccination health centre in a file photo. (Justin Tallis/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Toronto’s Plan to Decriminalize Hard Drugs an ‘Absolute Disaster,’ Says Ontario Premier
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford and Economic Development Minister Vic Fedeli look on as the legislature resumes at Queen's Park in Toronto on Feb. 21, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Frank Gunn)

title: Consumer Group Concerned as Banks Wrongly Close and Label Accounts as Fraudulent
description: UK five pound, ten pound, twenty pound, and fifty pound notes with one pound coins, shown in a file photo dated Jan. 26, 2018. (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

title: Unseeded Vondrousova Stuns Jabeur to Win Wimbledon Title
description: Czech Republic's Marketa Vondrousova celebrates with the trophy winning her final match against Tunisia’s Ons Jabeur during the 2023 Wimbledon tennis championships at The All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club, in London, Britain, on July 15, 2023. (Andrew Couldridge/Reuters)

title: Israel’s Netanyahu Hospitalized but Okay, His Office Says
description: An ambulance is seen at the entrance to the emergency room of Sheba Medical Center in Tel Hashomer, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was hospitalized, in Ramat Gan, Israel, on July 15, 2023. (Rami Amichay/Reuters)

title: ‘Absolutely Horrific’: US Doctors’ Group Comes Out Against CCP’s Forced Organ Harvesting
description: Dr. Richard Amerling, former President of the Association of American Physicians and Surgeons, in Kissimmee, Fla., on Oct. 17, 2022.(York Du/The Epoch Times)

title: IMF Hints Allowing Countries to Use Chinese Yuan for Debt Repayment
description: Chinese 100 yuan notes and one U.S. dollar notes in Beijing on Jan. 6, 2017. (Fred Dufour/AFP via Getty Images)

title: UK Battered by Wind and Rain as Met Office Issues Weekend Weather Warnings
description: A woman is caught in heavy rain in Speke, Liverpool, England, on July 8, 2023. (Peter Byrne/PA)

title: Clinic Director ‘Was Not Prepared’ for Level of Gaming Disorders
description: A gamer holding a PS4 controller in London on March 28, 2019. (Alex Pantling/Getty Images)

title: 6 German Tourists Arrested for Suspected Rape of German Teen in Hotel on Spanish Island of Mallorca
description: Catalan regional police Mossos d'Esquadra trucks in Spain in a file photo. (Pau Barrena/AFP via Getty Images)

title: 21 International Experts Dispute Prevailing US Gender Transition Methods
description: DeTransition advocates protest outside of the annual Pediatric Endocrine Society conference held in San Diego, Calif., on May 6, 2023. (John Fredicks/The Epoch Times)

title: Dutch Voters Will Go to the Polls on Nov. 22 After the Fall of Mark Rutte’s Coalition
description: Outgoing Prime Minister Mark Rutte announces he is leaving politics during a debate in the House of Representatives following the fall of the cabinet, in The Hague, Netherlands, on July 10, 2023. (Remko de Waal/ANP/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Gloomy Outlook for China Exports, as Economy Struggles to Recover Amid Weakened Global Demand
description: Containers are seen at the Yangshan Deep-Water Port in Shanghai, China, on Oct.  19, 2020. (Aly Song/Reuters)

title: Emergencies Minister Mobilizes Military to Help Fight BC Wildfires
description: Minister of Emergency Preparedness Bill Blair rises during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Feb. 28, 2022. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)

title: Ukraine Receives Cluster Munitions, Pledges Limited Use
description: Ukrainian military serviceman Igor Ovcharruck holds a defused cluster bomb from an MSLR missile, among a display of pieces of rockets used by Russian army, that a Ukrainian munitions expert said did not explode on impact, in the region of Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Oct. 21, 2022. (Clodagh Kilcoyne/Reuters)

title: Putin Says He Offered Wagner Mercenaries the Option to Stay as a Single Unit
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin chairs a Security Council meeting via video conference at the Kremlin in Moscow on July 14, 2023. (Aleksey Babushkin, Sputnik, Kremlin Pool Photo via AP)

title: Subtropical Storm Don Forms in Open Atlantic Waters and Becomes the Fifth Named Storm of the Year
description: Faja dos Cuberes is pictured on Sao Jorge island, in the Portuguese archipelago of the Azores, on March 28, 2022. (Patricia De Melo Moreira/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Landlords’ Profit Margins Minimal, Human Resources Committee Hears
description: A person walks by a row of houses in Toronto on July 12, 2022. (Cole Burston/The Canadian Press)

title: Authors Lose Millions in Royalties, Writers’ Group Says Government Is Culpable
description: Books are shown on a bookshelf in Ottawa on Jan. 7, 2011. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)
